page.title: 16BRIDGE OF WEIR - RAILWAY
page.content: When the line opened in{1864}it ran from{Princes Pier}in{Greenock}to {Glasgow.}It was used to transport coal , leather and imported Irish cattle. Passengers from{Trans-Atlantic}liners calling at{Greenock}used boat-train expresses on the line. During the war it was used to carry troops and supplies. Latterly passengers from the village were shoppers, children at private schools and business men commuting to {Glasgow. As more people bought cars, the line had insufficient passengers to run at a profit and was closed in 1983 and replaced by an{express bus service. A rigourous campaign to save the line was in vain and the tracks were dismantled. Many villagers say it should never have been closed while others prefer new transport facilities
